meanings.definition: To seek information by asking questions.
meanings.sent1: I will inquire about the time of the party.
meanings.sent2: She likes to inquire about people's hobbies.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to inquire about the mysterious noise.
meanings.sent4: The detective will inquire into the case further.
meanings.sent5: Please inquire with the receptionist for more details.

meanings.definition: To investigate or look into something.
meanings.sent1: The police officer will inquire into the robbery.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often inquire into the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to inquire into the strange noise coming from the basement.
meanings.sent4: The journalist will inquire into the corruption scandal.
meanings.sent5: Let's inquire into the reasons behind the sudden increase in prices.

meanings.definition: To make a formal request for information.
meanings.sent1: I will inquire with the school administration about the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will inquire with the court for more evidence.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to inquire with the teacher about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent4: The customer will inquire with the company about the product warranty.
meanings.sent5: Please inquire with the HR department for the employee handbook.
